default.Text: The RACI Model is a useful tool for establishing what responsibilities the different stakeholders will have during the change process.

aspects.Text:
Responsible – those responsible for implementing a task on time
		Accountable – responsible for signing off a task once complete
		Consulted – someone whose opinion is required
		Informed – stakeholders that must be kept up to date on progress and any decisions

responsible.Text: Responsible – those responsible for implementing a task on time

accountable.Text: Accountable – responsible for signing off a task once complete

consulted.Text: Consulted – someone whose opinion is required

informed.Text: stakeholders that must be kept up to date on progress and any decisions

more.Text: There are several change management models, that when used effectively, can support you in determining how and who the change will affect and any risks involved. Watch the next course on Change Management Models to learn more.

What.Text:
We currently have a whole section on body language which 
		consists of two videos, four docs, and 5 external links. 

		Which source would you like to use to boost your knowledge?

need.Text:
My resource tell me that you need to consider body language, 
		would you like to look at body language resource or 
		we can look a study by Professor Albert Mehrabian's on ‘Communication Model’?

communication models.Text:
There are three key communication models which are Shannon/Weaver 
		communication model, Berlo communication model, and 
		Schramn communication model. 

		Which one would you like to look at?

struggle.Text:
Is there a specific situation this happening such as: 
		During presentations
		When talking to clients
		Motivating a team
		Suggest general communication
